alert.note: Alert for Prince William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 07 at 12:43AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CHARLES AND SOUTHEASTERN PRINCE WILLIAM COUNTIES... At 1242 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Dumfries, or near Woodbridge, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Waldorf, Dale City, La Plata, Woodbridge, Quantico, Port Tobacco River, Nanjemoy Creek, Lake Ridge, Montclair, Triangle, Dumfries, Saint Charles, Cherry Hill, Independent Hill, Bryans Road, Mason Neck, Potomac Heights, Pomfret, Port Tobacco Village and Ironsides. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
